instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Green light but wont turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message: If you have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present, i guess should be a bad <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
Only 15" 2009 have that problem. 13" are unaffected by the cap plague. If 1.05v is present on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>, you will have to start looking elsewhere.

Does <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> go up to 3.3v when you press power button? Do the rest of the power rails in the machine work? There's a lot more here than JUST <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Voltage on pin 5 of <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>? Is it possible to power it on in SMC bypass mode? Remove power and battery, press power button and insert AC adapter, keep holding power button for another 5 seconds. Release it and press it again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message: I have a question on this one. I do not get 3.3V when I press power. But if I put into SMC bypass I get 3.3V. (On <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>)
